result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry J. Kirton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay restitution in the amount of $13.50 to Pre-Played located at 3868 E. Washington Suite D, Madison, WI
--to pay restitution in the amount of $15.00 to Pawn America located at 2301 E. Springs Drive, Madison, WI
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee

Per Standing Court Order defendant to pay 5% restitution surcharge

The Court does NOT order DNA surcharge due to date of violation

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with Deborah Doehl and Marcus Kasper

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 8:48am [mo]
Defendant Henry J. Kirton in court with Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance, indicates that the victim is present in the courtroom gallery and that she wishes to address the court.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Victim makes statement to the Court

Sentencing Arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Shock submits Victim Impact Statement


On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--No contact with Deborah Doehl and Marcus Kasper
--to pay restitution in the amount of $13.50 to Pre-Played located at 3868 E. Washington Suite D, Madison, WI
--to pay restitution in the amount of $15.00 to Pawn America located at 2301 E. Springs Drive, Madison, WI
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $243  

The Court does NOT order DNA surcharge due to date of violation


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 9:19am
Granting Defendant's Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel; Another Attorney from SPD shall be appointed
to Withdraw as Counsel, Defendant's Attorney's

Case called at 10:32am [mo]
Defendant Henry J. Kirton in court with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Ricker submits Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
--Mr. Kirton does not object
--The Court signs proposed Motion to Withdraw

The PD office is to appoint Mr. Kirton new counsel.
recess: 10:34am

NEXT: Status Conference: September 8, 2015 at 8:30am
Status conference on July 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 10, 2015 at 09:20 am.

[MK] case called at 3:00pm. 
Defendant Henry J. Kirton in court with Attorney Joseph M Ricker.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Kirton indicates that the date of birth on the Complaint is correct.  Mr. Kirton provides his current address:  140 E. Avenue, Apt. C, PO Box 312, Iron Ridge WI 53035. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense.

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no contact with Deborah Weller (aka Deborah Wehler) or Marcus Kasper
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 3:07pm.
